tr: the delivery and collection of letters and packages
example: it came by the first post
if you hurry you'll catch the post

tr: a job in an organization
example: he occupied a post in the treasury

tr: military installation at which a body of troops is stationed
example: this military post provides an important source of income for the town nearby
there is an officer's club on the post

tr: an upright consisting of a piece of timber or metal fixed firmly in an upright position
example: he set a row of posts in the ground and strung barbwire between them

tr: the system whereby messages are transmitted via the post office
example: the mail handles billions of items every day
he works for the United States mail service
in England they call mail `the post'

tr: a pole or stake set up to mark something (as the start or end of a race track)
example: a pair of posts marked the goal
the corner of the lot was indicated by a stake

tr: any particular collection of letters or packages that is delivered
example: your mail is on the table
is there any post for me?
she was opening her post

tr: the position where someone (as a guard or sentry) stands or is assigned to stand
example: a soldier manned the entrance post
a sentry station

tr: publicize with, or as if with, a poster
example: I'll post the news on the bulletin board

tr: display, as of records in sports games
mark or expose as infamous
example: She was branded a loose woman

tr: cause to be directed or transmitted to another place
example: send me your latest results
I'll mail you the paper when it's written

tr: assign to a station
place so as to be noticed
example: post a sign
post a warning at the dump

tr: mark with a stake
example: stake out the path

tr: affix in a public place or for public notice
example: post a warning

tr: ride Western style and bob up and down in the saddle in rhythm with a horse's trotting gait
transfer (entries) from one account book to another
assign to a post
put into a post
example: The newspaper posted him in Timbuktu

tr: enter on a public list

means: 邮寄的信函(或包裹等)，邮件
收集（或投递）邮件的时间，邮班
把(信件等)投入邮筒，投递

example.tran: 书会邮递给你。
example.ex: You'll receive your book through the post...

example.tran: 获胜者将以邮件形式通知。
example.ex: The winner will be notified by post...

example.tran: 支票已寄出。
example.ex: The cheque is in the post.

value.def: The post is the public service or system by which letters and packages are collected and delivered.

value.boxr_value: in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 mail

example.tran: 他飞快地翻了一下邮件，但一封也没有打开。
example.ex: He flipped through the post without opening any of it...

example.tran: 3个星期都没有邮件。
example.ex: There has been no post in three weeks.

value.def: You can use post to refer to letters and packages that are delivered to you.

value.boxr_value: in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 mail

example.tran: 参赛作品必须在下周三第一批邮件之前寄达。
example.ex: Entries must arrive by first post next Wednesday...

example.tran: 他们只好耐心地等下一批邮件。
example.ex: They just have to wait patiently for the next post.

value.def: Post is used to refer to an occasion when letters or packages are delivered. For example, first post on a particular day is the first time that things are delivered.

example.tran: 如果我写封信，你能替我寄出去吗？
example.ex: If I write a letter, would you post it for me?...

example.tran: 我今晚会给你寄支票。
example.ex: I'm posting you a cheque tonight...

example.tran: 我给斯坦利寄了封信，说我是他的一个老战友。
example.ex: I posted a letter to Stanley saying I was an old Army friend.

example.tran: 他让我整理并投递邮件。
example.ex: He'd left me to pack up the mail and post it off...

example.tran: 你所要做的就是填写并寄出表格。
example.ex: All you do is complete and post off a form.

value.def: If you post a letter or package, you send it to someone by putting it in a post box or by taking it to a post office.

value.boxr_value: in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 mail

example.tran: 官员们开始张贴警告。
example.ex: Officials began posting warning notices...

example.tran: 她已把照片贴在了公告牌上。
example.ex: She has posted photographs on bulletin boards.

example.tran: 他已经张贴了一张“禁止钓鱼”的告示牌。
example.ex: He has posted a sign up that says 'No Fishing'...

example.tran: 我们张贴了一份房屋生活守则。
example.ex: We post up a set of rules for the house.

value.def: If you post notices, signs, or other pieces of information somewhere, you fix them to a wall or board so that everyone can see them.

example.tran: 一份征询意见书已贴在了因特网上，欢迎网络用户发表意见。
example.ex: A consultation paper has been posted on the Internet inviting input from Net users.

value.def: If you post information on the Internet, you make the information available to other people on the Internet.

example.tran: 让我随时了解你们的进展。
example.ex: Keep me posted on your progress.

value.tran: 向…提供最新信息；使及时了解
value.def: If you keep someone posted, you keep giving them the latest information about a situation that they are interested in.

example.tran: 她早些时候辞去了梅内姆总统助理一职。
example.ex: She had earlier resigned her post as President Menem's assistant...

example.tran: 彼得爵士担任过几个高级军事职务。
example.ex: Sir Peter has held several senior military posts.

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>of/as</l> n

value.def: A post in a company or organization is a job or official position in it, usually one that involves responsibility.

example.tran: 培训结束后她被派往布里克斯顿。
example.ex: After training she was posted to Brixton...

example.tran: 被派往海外之前，通常会在这个国家工作两三年。
example.ex: It is normal to spend two or three years working in this country before being posted overseas.

value.def: If you are posted somewhere, you are sent there by the organization that you work for and usually work there for several years.

example.tran: 迅速返回各自岗位！
example.ex: Quick men, back to your post!

value.def: You can use post to refer to the place where a soldier, guard, or other person has been told to remain and to do his or her job.

example.tran: 现在所有神殿外都已安排警察站岗。
example.ex: Police have now been posted outside all temples...

example.tran: 英国铁路公司不得不在隧道入口设置了一名信号员。
example.ex: British Rail had to post a signalman at the entrance to the tunnel...

example.tran: 我们已在窗户附近设了岗哨。
example.ex: We have guards posted near the windows.

value.def: If a soldier, guard, or other person is posted somewhere, they are told to stand there, in order to supervise an activity or guard a place.

example.tran: 你得找来8根木桩，并把它们敲入地里。
example.ex: You have to get eight wooden posts, and drive them into the ground...

example.tran: 这个装置被固定在杆子上。
example.ex: The device is fixed to a post.

value.def: A post is a strong upright pole made of wood or metal that is fixed into the ground.

example.tran: 温布尔登队运气不佳，两次将球踢到门柱上，最终没有获胜。
example.ex: Wimbledon were unlucky not to win after hitting the post twice.

value.def: A post is the same as a goalpost .
On a horse-racing track, the post is a pole which marks the finishing point.

xrse.def: to pip someone at the post

data.enText: letters
mail
the official system used for sending and delivering letters, packages, etc.
I'll send the original to you by post .
I'll put the information in the post to you tomorrow.
data.chText: 我明天会把资料邮寄给你。

data.enText: My application got lost in the post .
mail
letters, packages, etc. that are sent and delivered
data.chText: 邮寄的信函（或包裹等）；邮件

data.enText: There was a lot of post this morning.
Have you opened your post yet?
an occasion during the day when letters, etc. are collected or delivered
data.chText: 收集（或投递）邮件的时间；邮班

data.enText: to catch/miss the post
The parcel came in this morning's post.
data.chText: 这个包裹是今天上午邮送来的。

data.enText: Payment should be sent by return of post (= immediately) .
job
a job, especially an important one in a large organization
an academic/government post
to take up a post
to resign (from) a post
We will be creating 15 new posts next year.
data.chText: 明年我们将增设15个新职位。

data.enText: The company has been unable to fill the post .
data.chText: 公司的这个空缺还未能填补。

data.enText: He has held the post for three years.
data.chText: 他担任这个职务已经三年了。

data.enText: for soldier/guard
the place where sb, especially a soldier, does their job
a police/customs/military post
data.chText: 警察岗亭；海关关卡；军事哨所

data.enText: an observation post
The guards were ordered not to leave their posts.
data.chText: 警卫受命不得擅离岗位。

data.enText: wood/metal
a piece of wood or metal that is set in the ground in a vertical position, especially to support sth or to mark a position
corner posts (= that mark the corners of a sports field)
end of race
the place where a race finishes, especially in horse racing
football
The ball hit the post and bounced in.
data.chText: 球击在门柱上弹进了球门。

data.enText: be driven, pushed, etc. from pillar to post
to be forced to go from one person or situation to another without achieving anything
data.chText: 被迫四处碰壁（或到处奔波）

data.enText: letters
mail
to send a letter, etc. to sb by post/mail
Have you posted off your order yet?

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: Is it OK if I post the cheque to you next week?
data.chText: 我下周把支票寄给你行不行？

data.enText: Is it OK if I post you the cheque next week?
data.chText: 我下周寄给你支票可以吗？

data.enText: mail
to put a letter, etc. into a postbox
data.chText: 把（信件等）投入邮筒；投递；邮寄

data.enText: Could you post this letter for me?
data.chText: 请把这封信替我寄了好吗？

data.enText: sth through hole
to put sth through a hole into a container
Let yourself out and post the keys through the letter box.
data.chText: 你先出去，再把这些钥匙塞进信箱吧。

data.enText: sb for job
to send sb to a place for a period of time as part of their job
She's been posted to Washington for two years.
data.chText: 她被派往华盛顿工作两年。

data.enText: Most of our employees get posted abroad at some stage.
data.chText: 我们的大部分雇员都会在某一时期派驻国外。

data.enText: soldier/guard
to put sb, especially a soldier, in a particular place so that they can guard a building or area
Guards have been posted along the border.
data.chText: 边界上已部署了边防岗哨。

data.enText: public notice
to put a notice, etc. in a public place so that people can see it
A copy of the letter was posted on the noticeboard.
data.chText: 布告牌上张贴了这封信的内容。

data.enText: The results will be posted on the Internet.
data.chText: 结果将在互联网上公布。

data.enText: give information
to announce sth publicly or officially, especially financial information or a warning
data.chText: 发布，公布，宣布（尤指财经信息或警告）

data.enText: The company posted a $1.1 billion loss.
data.chText: 这家公司公布了11亿元的亏损。

data.enText: A snow warning was posted for Ohio.
data.chText: 俄亥俄州已发出大雪警报。

data.enText: The aircraft and its crew were posted missing .
data.chText: 据报这架飞机和机组人员已失踪。

data.enText: pay money to court
to pay money to a court so that a person accused of a crime can go free until their trial
She was released after posting $100 cash bond and her driver's license.
data.chText: 交了100元现款保释金及驾驶执照以后，她获得保释了。

data.enText: keep sb posted (about/on sth)
to regularly give sb the most recent information about sth and how it is developing

data.text: job ♦ post ♦ position ♦ vacancy ♦ placement ♦ appointment ♦ opening

data.enText: These are all words for a position doing work for which you receive regular payment.
data.chText: 以上各词均表示工作、职位。

data.enText: job
a position doing work for which you receive regular payment
He's trying to get a job in a bank.
data.chText: 他正设法在银行找一个工作。

data.enText: post
a job, especially an important one in a large organization
data.chText: 指职位，尤指大机构的要职：

data.enText: a key post in the new government
position
( rather formal ) a job
a senior position in a large corporation
data.chText: 在一家大公司的高级职务

data.enText: job or position?

Position usually refers to a particular job within an organization, especially at a high level, and is not usually used about jobs generally. It is also often used in job applications, descriptions and advertisements.
data.chText: position通常指机构中的职位，尤指高级职位，通常不用以指一般的工作。该词亦常用于工作申请、职位说明和招聘广告中。

data.enText: vacancy
a job that is available for sb to do
We have several vacancies for casual workers.
data.chText: 我们有几个临时工的空缺。

data.enText: placement
( BrE ) a job, often as part of a course of study, in which you get experience of a particular type of work
a summer placement with a computer firm
data.chText: 在一家计算机公司的暑期实习

data.enText: appointment
( rather formal , especially BrE ) a job or position of responsibility
data.chText: 指承担一定责任的职务、职位：

data.enText: This is a permanent appointment, requiring commitment and hard work.
data.chText: 这是一个固定职位，需要专心致志和勤奋工作。

data.enText: opening
a job that is available for sb to do
There are several openings in the sales department.
vacancy or opening?

These words have the same meaning and there is very little difference in their use. Vacancy is more frequent, especially in British English. Opening is slightly more informal and is used more in American English and in financial journalism.
data.chText: 以上两词意思相同，用法上没什么区别。vacancy较常用，尤其是在英国英语中。opening较非正式，较多用于美国英语和财经报刊中。

data.enText: a permanent/temporary job/post/position/vacancy/placement/appointment/opening
a full-time/part-time job/post/position/vacancy/placement/appointment/opening
to have/have got a(n) job/post/position/vacancy/placement/appointment/opening
to apply for a job/post/position/vacancy/placement
to hold a(n) job/post/position/appointment
to fill a(n) job/post/position/vacancy/appointment/opening
to resign from/leave/quit a job/post/position
Nouns
In BrE the official system used for sending and delivering letters, parcels/packages, etc. is usually called the post . In NAmE it is usually called the mail .
data.chText: 邮政系统在英国英语中通常叫做post，在北美英语中通常称为mail：

data.enText: I’ll put an application form in the post/mail for you today.
data.chText: 我今天会把申请表邮寄给你。

data.enText: Send your fee by post/mail to this address.
Mail is sometimes used in BrE in such expressions as
the Royal Mail.
data.chText: 在英国英语中，mail有时用于the Royal Mail（皇家邮政）等短语中。

data.enText: Post occurs in NAmE in such expressions as
the US Postal Service.
data.chText: 在北美英语中，post出现在the US Postal Service（美国邮政管理局）等短语中。

data.enText: In BrE post is also used to mean the letters, parcels/packages, etc. that are delivered to you. Mail is the usual word in NAmE and is sometimes also used in BrE .
data.chText: 在英国英语中，post亦指邮件。mail在北美英语中为常用词，有时亦用于英国英语：

data.enText: Was there any post/mail this morning?
I sat down to open my post/mail.
data.chText: 我坐下来打开我的邮件。

data.enText: Verbs
Compare
I’ll post the letter when I go out.
data.chText: 我出门时去寄这封信。（英国英语）

data.enText: ( BrE ) and
I’ll mail the letter when I go out.
( NAmE )
data.chText: 我出门时去寄这封信。（北美英语 ）

data.enText: Compounds
Note these words: postman ( BrE ), mailman / mail carrier (both NAmE ); postbox ( BrE ), mailbox ( NAmE ). Some compounds are used in both BrE and NAmE : post office , postcard , mail order .
data.chText: 注意下列词汇：邮递员英国英语为postman，北美英语为mailman/mail carrier，邮筒英国英语为postbox，北美英语为mailbox。有些复合词既用于英国英语，也用于北美英语，如post office（邮局）、postcard（明信片）、mail order（邮购）。

data.enText: Electronic
Mail , not post , is always used in connection with electronic messages: email , voicemail .
data.chText: 与电子信息有关总是用mail，而非post，如email（电子邮件）、voicemail（语音信箱）。

data.enText: (as) deaf as a post
very deaf
data.chText: 全聋；聋得什么也听不见

data.enText: be driven, pushed, etc. from pillar to post
to be forced to go from one person or situation to another without achieving anything
data.chText: 被迫四处碰壁（或到处奔波）

data.enText: keep sb posted (about/on sth)
to regularly give sb the most recent information about sth and how it is developing

trans: 邮局；邮政部门；邮政系统
华盛顿邮报公司；华盛顿邮报
外侧应；高位（罚球弧的周围）；高级职位
中国邮政；中国邮报；英文中国邮报
后处理；处理后；治疗后；后治疗；后系列
（总）邮包，包裹邮件；邮政包裹业务
(尤指北美旧时偏远地区的)贸易站

synonyms.bx: 指为达到某个特殊目的而将某人或某物送到某地。

ex.enText: A group of doctors were dispatched to Africa to provide medical service.
ex.chText: 一队医生被派往非洲提供医疗服务。

ex.enText: Two helicopters were dispatched to rescue the injured.
ex.chText: 派了两架直升飞机去救援伤者。

synonyms.bx: 尤指为了进行销售将某物运至某地。

ex.enText: The TV sets will be consigned to the agent tomorrow.
ex.chText: 这批电视机将于明天送到代理商处。

ex.enText: Consign the said goods by express mail.
ex.chText: 将上述货物以快件发送。

synonyms.bx: 指通过邮局寄送物品，也指被派往某地工作一段时间，作后者解时通常用被动语态。

ex.enText: Remember to post the letter on your way home.
ex.chText: 回家的路上记得把信寄出去。

ex.enText: He was posted to London in 2010.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指发送或寄送某物，也指吩咐或安排某人去某地。

ex.enText: We sent the fridge back to the manufacturer.
ex.chText: 我们把那台冰箱退给厂家了。

ex.enText: Did you get the letter I sent to you last week?
ex.chText: 你收到我上星期给你寄的信了吗？

ex.enText: Beth was sent to private school.
ex.chText: 贝丝被送进了私立学校。
